thread.title: Fifa opens proceedings against Neil Taylor following the Wales defender’s leg-breaking horror tackle on Republic of Ireland defender Seamus Coleman
thread.title_full: Fifa opens proceedings against Neil Taylor following the Wales defender’s leg-breaking horror tackle on Republic of Ireland defender Seamus Coleman

author: ashilton
title: Fifa opens proceedings against Neil Taylor following the Wales defender’s leg-breaking horror tackle on Republic of Ireland defender Seamus Coleman
text:
Comments FIFA have opened proceedings against Neil Taylor for his leg-breaking horror tackle on Seamus Coleman. 
Wales defender Taylor’s challenge snapped the Everton man’s leg in two and he now faces a prolonged ban, with the Dragons already facing an uphill task to qualify for the 2018 World Cup . Getty Images 9 Neil Taylor faces a lengthy Fifa ban for the tackle that broke Seamus Coleman’s leg 
The hearing is likely to be held within the next fortnight and Taylor’s automatic one-match ban could be increased to three games once Fifa study ref Nicola Rizzoli’s report 
Keep up to date with all the latest news, gossip, rumours and done deals in SunSport’s live transfer blog 
Coleman needed surgery on a broken tibia and fibula following the 69th-minute lunge in Friday’s goalless draw. 
The Everton defender faces months on the sidelines and Taylor who, along with suspended Gareth Bale , will definitely miss Wales’ next qualifier away to Serbia in June, now faces the prospect of a lengthier spell away. 
Coleman, 28, was given oxygen as he was stricken on the floor on Ireland’s right flank before being whisked away for surgery. He headed to St Vincent’s University hospital in Dublin before undergoing successful surgery on Saturday.
